intro: Helichrysum macivorii, commonly known as the Cape goldcup, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its bright yellow, sun-like flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and is often found in rocky or sandy soils. It is drought-tolerant and thrives in full sunlight, making it a hardy ornamental plant. Its flowers are also used in traditional medicine and as a source of essential oils.
